I am going to extract the cursor and make it my computer mouse.
I really hate it, I find it fat, ugly and distracting. I really want an option to turn it off.

> 
> I really hate it, I find it fat, ugly and distracting. I really want an option to turn it off.

I agree. I'm so used to the regular mouse, and really don't like anything that isn't stock.

I want an option too. I guess it's in the game files.

> 
> I am going to extract the cursor and make it my computer mouse.

I was actually thinking about doing this.
I like it! A nice subtle touch of detail!
no way i hate it, I really want an option to turn it off too.

I like it too, but I agree that there should probably be an option to revert to your standard cursor.

And could it have some size options? It's kinda big.

I like it a lot. Have you noticed that when you left click, it turns green, but when you right click, it turns brown? I really appreciate it. It's one of those tiny features that makes the game feel more complete.

Guys, look up "reactionary" in the dictionary~

It's shaped like a triangle, the hotspot is in the right place, and it's not any LESS visible than the badly designed winfail pointer (which was shamelessly ripped off of that PARC machine).

There are much more serious issues to deal with, like map icons still being bugged or the radial attachment being wonky sometimes.
So? It's a 2 second add.

> 
> So? It's a 2 second add.

Uh, no, replacing a single constant for them is 4.5 years\*. Three lines of code - same thing. Making that an option in the GUI would take dozens of lines of code to implement.. soo.... 15 years? 20? Bugfixing is more important. For instance, I'd like my map icons to work without having to pull up the navball, and for things to OBEY the radial symmetry root mode rather than randomly radial-ifying around the current part. Maybe we can have the map icons working in time for my retirement.

\* - they may not have done this yet in fact. I haven't tested yet.

I love the new pointer. Yes, **pointer**, not cursor.

These are cursors.

![jdkhelp2.gif](http://workbench.cadenhead.org/images/jdkhelp2.gif)

Jesus, I don't think I've ever seen a more... divided community when it comes to KSP.

"It's amazing and so clean. I want to make it my default mouse and look at it 24/7"

"It's horrible and so ugly. I want it to die, painfully, in a fire, caused by burning lemons"

Personally, I like it, but is it really this important, guys? ![:wink:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

you may have just started a debate as controversial as "How many spaces go after a period?"
Look guys, tabs should be exactly four spaces long, and anyone who disagree

> 
> Look guys, tabs should be exactly four spaces long, and anyone who disagree

Tabs should not be 4 spaces.

> 
> Look guys, tabs should be exactly four spaces long, and anyone who disagree

Haha dying. Be careful where you use this sentence. It's powerful enough to derail the hypetrain
I think it's fine, honestly, and a custom cursor is definetly better than the default windows or system cursor.

> 
> Do you ever get tired of intentionally misrepresenting windows or bashing microsoft for asinine reasons?

Good job quoting the wrong post, by the way.

Do you deny it was basically a copy of the Xerox Alto system's pointer, developed at PARC? (Note that I care less if it was copied directly, or indirectly from Apple's own copy. Ripping off a rip-off would still be a rip-off). Do you deny that it has a relatively poor visibility in almost all modern applications (ever notice how white is the common background)?

Disclaimer: I am a Microsoft Certified System Engineer and a member of the MVP program and thus everything I say has to be taken as having a slightly pro-Microsoft slant.

> 
> Your second response can be summed up as "this feature sucks because squad didn't add what I wanted, and what I want matters more"

So you think turning off the custom mouse cursor is more important than fixing *long-standing bugs*? Do you not get annoyed when your fuel lines end up attached to the left booster only, because it goes into some sort of part-local symmetry even though it's currently set for ship/global mode? That damn bug has been in the game since AT LEAST 0.22!

If the custom cursor bothers you so much, just override it.

(Apologies to the cursor/pointer fellow; I started on the command line over thirty three years ago and the terminology is kinda stuck ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif) )

Well... I think that the game needs life support. The game not having life support is more important than the minor bugs, any bug fixes are thus stupid and squad should just focus on life support.

I think it really adds to the retro 90's computer game feel and is very in keeping with the dotty lo-fi font.

Squad should go further and remove true decenders from the interface to complete the look.
